body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series.

[b]Matsuura Nanase[/b] is one of the characters from the [[Macross Frontier]] science fiction [[mecha]] anime TV series.

Nanase is a voluptuous shy girl with glasses who is also [[Ranka Lee]]'s best friend.

title: meryl_silverburgh
body:
A fictional female character from the [[metal_gear_(series)|Metal Gear]] stealth action [[video game]] series by [[Konami]]. 

She also appears in the [[Policenauts]] science fiction [[cyberpunk]] video game from the 90s. Voiced by Debi Mae West.
other_names: メリル・シルバーバーグ

title: luca_angeloni
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. 

[b]Luca Angeloni[/b] is one of the characters of the [[Macross Frontier]] science fiction [[mecha]] anime TV series.

h4. See also

* [[S.M.S.]]

title: art3mis
body:
A character from the popular [[Ready Player One]] science fiction novel from 2011 (and its 2018 film adaptation).

She is the "OASIS" [[video game]] avatar of [spoiler] [[Samantha Cook]], a female [[otaku]] character from the film.

title: leech_(she-ra)
body: A fictional [[alien]] character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. It first appeared in the second cartoon series [i]She-Ra: Princess of Power[/i] in 1985.

title: tri-klops
body: A character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. He first appeared in the original cartoon series from 1983.

title: evil-lyn
body: A fictional female character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. She first appeared in the original cartoon series from 1983.

title: mer-man
body: A fictional [[alien]] character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. It first appeared in the original cartoon series from 1983.

title: shadow_weaver
body: A fictional female character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. She first appeared in the second cartoon series [i]She-Ra: Princess of Power[/i] in 1985.

title: karita_trakajiide
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] universe. He appears in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] science fiction anime series from 1982.

[b]Karita Trakajiide[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] [[soldier]] trained in the operation of the [[miclonization chamber]].

title: dagao
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] universe. He appears in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] science fiction anime series from 1982. 

[b]Dagao[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] fleet commander in charge of his own fleet which is tasked with the protection of an automated factory satellite.

title: trilobite_(prometheus)
body: A [[tentacles|tentacled]] [[alien]] [[monster]] from the [[prometheus_(movie)|Prometheus]] science fiction horror film.

title: hammerpede
body: An [[alien]] [[monster]] from the [[prometheus_(movie)|Prometheus]] science fiction horror film.

title: antigravity_unit
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

The [b]Antigravity Unit[/b] also known as the [b]Antigravity Device[/b] (反重力装置), is an enemy machine boss character from the original coin-op and all its ports.

The Antigravity Device was created by [[Grand Master Meio]] in order to achieve total control of gravity in a specified area or system, and serves as a sort of antigravity engine for the [[Flying Battleship Balrog]]. Its core computer is sentient and moves around within the system, capturing any enemy that comes close to its gravity pull, and then throws them violently against a wall.

title: ozma_lee
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. 

[b]Ozma Lee[/b] is one of the characters of the [[Macross Frontier]] science fiction [[mecha]] anime TV series.

h4. See also

* [[S.M.S.]]

title: mecha_pon
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

[b]Mecha Pon[/b] (メカポン), also written Mecha Pong (メカ [i]Pongu[/i]), is an enemy [[robot]] boss character from the original coin-op and all its ports.

He is basically a [[giant]] mechanical [[gorilla]]. His name and design are homages to Toho's movie character Mechani-Kong.

title: lago
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] series. It appears in the first arcade game from 1989.

[b]Lago[/b] is a mechanical [[monster]] that serves as end level boss during the game. Its body is a bizarre mix formed by the basic shape of a dinosaur, the clawing mannerisms of a chicken, and a head based off the front of an [[f-16 fighting falcon|F-16]] jet fighter.

title: crea_coral
body: A fictional female character from the [[Assault Suits Valken]] science fiction action [[video game]] released in 1992.

title: novo
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

[b]Novo[/b] (ノボ) is a minor automated boss character from the first Strider and all its ports. It appears as a laser-firing static mini-boss during the game. 

Novo is basically an anti-personal laser battery installed for self-defense purposes and is formed by an irregular-shaped pod with 4 laser emitters on its top and what appears to be an eye on its front, as well as a red energy gauge that depletes as it receives damage.

title: mosqueman
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

[b]Mosqueman[/b] (モスクマン) is an arachnid [[robot]] that is one of the stage enemies found in the original Strider and most of its ports. It's also one of the most recognizable enemy machines in the game, specially for the unique thumping sound  it makes when approaching the player.

title: flying_battleship_balrog
body:
A fictional air ship from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

The [b]Flying Battleship Balrog[/b] (空中戦艦バルログ or [i]Ballog[/i]), is an enemy vehicle from the original coin-op and all its ports.

The Flying Battleship Balrog is a giant aircraft carrier that flies through the skies with the use of gravity control, provided by the advanced [[Antigravity Unit]] installed in its engine core. Recognized for its overwhelming power and reach, it is known as one of [[Grand Master Meio]]'s greatest weapons in his quest to dominate Earth.

title: hit_mouse
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

The [b]Hit Mouse[/b] (ヒットマウス) is a minor stage [[robot]] enemy from the first Strider and most of its ports.

The Hit Mouse is a fast and agile small semi-spherical flying cannon drone which rotates and moves in a wavy line pattern while attacking. They are usually deployed in large groups of around 5 to 6 units, floating into view from either the top or bottom of the area, and move in waves as they constantly shoot at their acquired target.

title: mr._elephant
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

[b]Mr. Elephant[/b] (ゾウサン) is a minor stage enemy [[robot]] from the first Strider and most of its ports. Its name comes from its front being shaped like an [[elephant]]'s head, completed with spear-like weaponry in the place of its tusks. This enemy is also simply called the [b]Elephant-Type Robot[/b] (ゾウ型ロボット).

Mr. Elephant is also armed with small anti-personal tracking [[missile]]s.

title: frog_robot
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] from 1989.

The [b]Frog[/b] (カエル) [[Robot]] is a minor stage enemy from the first Strider and most of its ports. Its name likely comes from the shape of its front or "face", which when looked in profile is somewhat reminiscent of that of a [[frog]]'s. This enemy is also simply called the [b]Frog-Type Robot[/b] (カエル型ロボット).

title: sideswipe
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Sideswipe[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red [[Lamborghini Countach]] LP 500S sports [[car]].

In [[Japan]] his name was changed to [b]Lambor[/b].

Motto: [i]"I don't break rules, I just bend them - a lot...".[/i]

title: octane_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Octane[/b] is an evil [i]Triple Changer[/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a grey, dark blue and purple extended [[truck]] cab with fuel-tanker trailer (of undetermined model) or a twin-engined Boeing 767 [[jet]] plane.

Motto: [i]"He who has fuel, has power....".[/i]

h4. See also

* [[Astrotrain]]
* [[Blitzwing]]

title: ming_the_merciless
body:
A character from the classic [[flash gordon (series)|Flash Gordon]] science fiction franchise that first appeared in the original comic strip from 1934.

[b]Ming the Merciless[/b] is the main villain of the series. He is the supreme ruler of an alien planet called Mongo. Ming is tall, bald and has a peculiar goatie. He likes to wear opulent ceremonial outfits and military uniforms.

Ming was played by actor "Charles Middleton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Middleton_%28actor%29 in the three old live action film serials (made between 1936 and 1940) and by [[Max von Sydow]] in the 1980 Flash Gordon live action film adaptation.

title: omega_supreme
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Omega Supreme[/b] is an heroic [i]guardian[/i] [[Autobot]], a powerful and big sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into an orange, yellow and grey [[rocket]] and launch pad base.

Motto: [i]"Unyielding resolve has no conqueror...".[/i]

title: trailcutter
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Trailcutter[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a dark and silver Toyota Hilux 4WD camper [[truck]].

His official name was originally [b]Trailbreaker[/b], but it was changed later due to trademark issues.

Motto: [i]"An Autobot is as good as the fuel in his tank...".[/i]

title: sentinel_prime
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Sentinel Prime[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a [[Cybertron]]ian [[truck]]. 

In the [i]War for Cybertron[/i] [[video game]] his name was changed to [b]Sentinel Zeta Prime[/b].

Motto: [i]"Freedom without survival is a tragedy, survival without freedom is a curse...".[/i]

title: chromia
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Chromia[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] female [[robot]] that can transform into a blue Cybertronian [[truck]].

She is a warrior with expert marksmanship and the girlfriend of the Autobot [[Ironhide]].

In later series her alternate mode is a blue [[Cybertron]]ian [[motorcycle]].

The [[Decepticon]] [[Thunderblast]] shared her name in the Japanese version of [[Transformers Cybertron]].

Motto: [i]"Let actions speak for you...".[/i]

title: trypticon
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Trypticon[/b] is an evil [[Decepticon]], a massive sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] with the shape of a gigantic [[dinosaur]] that can transform into a grey, teal and purple heavily armed assault [[base]].

Motto: [i]"Total victory requires total destruction...".[/i]

title: sunstreaker
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Sunstreaker[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a yellow [[Lamborghini Countach]] sports [[car]].

Motto: [i]"They can't beat the best...".[/i]

title: inferno_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Inferno[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a [[firefighter]] [[truck]].

Motto: [i]"Where there’s smoke, there’s me...".[/i]

title: blaster_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Blaster[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red, yellow and grey [[stereo]] [[tape recorder]].

Motto: [i]"When the music is rockin, I'm rolling!...".[/i]
other_names: 通信兵ブロードキャスト

title: jetstorm
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Jetstorm[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a blue Cybertronian fighter [[jet]].

Motto: [i]"Give me more action! It's no fun unless I can see the whites of their eyes...".[/i]

title: tracks_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Tracks[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a dark blue Chevrolet Corvette C3 sports [[car]].

Motto: [i]"Looking good is what life is all about...".[/i]

title: leozack
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Leozack[/b] is an evil [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a teal and gray Grumman [[F-14 Tomcat]] fighter [[jet]].

In Japan his name was changed to [b]Reozak[/b] (レオザック [i]Reozakku[/i]).  

Motto: [i]"Ambition is the fuel of all great warriors...".[/i]

title: beachcomber_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Beachcomber[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a grey, silver and blue [[dune buggy]].

He is a geologist and biology scientist of the Autobots who can communicate with animals and is very fond of plants and trees. 

Motto: [i]"Know the conflict within, before facing the conflict without...".[/i]

title: mirage_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Mirage[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient alien [[robot]]. G1's Mirage can transform into a white and blue [i]Formula One[/i] [[racing]] [[car]] "Ligier JS11.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligier_JS11 His Japanese name, リジェ ([b]Ligier[/b]) came from the model.

Motto: [i]"Who and what I am, I hide from my enemy...".[/i]

h4.See also

* "Transformers Wikia":http://tfwiki.net/wiki/Mirage_%28G1%29
* "Pixiv tag search":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag&word=%E3%83%AA%E3%82%B8%E3%82%A7+%28%E3%83%88%E3%83%A9%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B9%E3%83%95%E3%82%A9%E3%83%BC%E3%83%9E%E3%83%BC+OR+Transformers%29

title: nightbeat
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Nightbeat[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a blue and yellow sports [[car]].

Motto: [i]"Truth is revealed in the smallest detail...".[/i]

title: astrotrain
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Astrotrain[/b] is an evil [i]Triple Changer[/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a [[space shuttle]] or a JNR Class D62 [[train]].

Motto: [i]"In confusion, there is opportunity...".[/i]

h4. See also

* [[Blitzwing]]
* [[octane_(transformers)|Octane]]

title: bb-8
body:
A fictional [[robot]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction franchise.

[b]BB-8[/b] is a spherical astromech droid that first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015. 

Contrary to popular belief, the robot's special effects are completely practical (it is actually a working remote-controlled prop) and do not have any [[3d|CGI]] at all.

BB-8's design is based in an early original concept by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie#Posthumous_work for the design of [[R2-D2]] during the production of the first Star Wars film from the 70s. Since that design's effects were too complex to create at the time, another more simple was used instead.

title: knockout_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Knockout[/b] is an evil [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red European sports [[car]].

Motto: [i]"I'm not only an automobile; I'm an automobile enthusiast!...".[/i]

title: metroplex
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Metroplex[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a very powerful and huge sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a massive [[base]].

In [[Japan]] his name was changed to [b]Metroflex[/b].

Motto: [i]"Vigilance is the foundation on which victories are built...".[/i]

title: bluestreak_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Bluestreak[/b] (also known as [b]Silverstreak[/b]) is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a silver, black and red Nissan Fairlady Z (Datsun 280ZX) sports [[car]].

Motto: [i]"I never met a [[Decepticon]] I didn't dislike...".[/i]

title: snare_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Snare[/b] is an evil [i]predator[/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a black, red, green and copper "X-29":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grumman_X-29 jet.

His original mode was a [[cybertron]]ian snubfighter.

Motto: [i]"Fear is another word for fun....!!!".[/i]

title: firestar_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Firestar[/b] (also known as [b]Novastar[/b]) is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] female [[robot]] that can transform into a red, silver and orange [[Cybertron]]ian [[fire truck]].

Motto: [i]"Where there's fire, there's me...".[/i]

title: skids_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Skids[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a blue Honda City Turbo subcompact hatchback [[car]].

Motto: [i]"Deep down, we are more like than unlike humans....".[/i]

title: gears_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Gears[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red and blue compact [[truck]].

Motto: [i]"Nobody wins a war - somebody loses...".[/i]

title: sheena_(strider)
body:
A character from the [[Strider (video game)]] science fiction franchise. She appears in the 1988 Strider manga as well as its 1989 [[NES]] [[video game]] adaptation.

[b]Sheena[/b] is a Strider perhaps not as deadly or combat capable as [[Strider Hiryuu]], but quite proficient with many types of firearms and long range weaponry.

title: strider_kain
body:
A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction franchise. He appears in the 1988 Strider manga as well as its 1989 [[NES]] [[video game]] adaptation.

[b]Kain[/b] (カイン) is an "A" class Strider who has been [[Strider Hiryuu]]'s friend since their time in training school. 

Kain's skill level is on par with Hiryuu's. He's shown to be disrespectful and playful while on duty, but he knows when to take the situation seriously. In the NES game he was depicted as a young man with blonde short hair and wearing a tan uniform sporting a stylized "C", which indicates that his name was probably intended to be originally written as [b]Cain[/b]. He also wears a blue scarf similar to Ryuu's and dark bracelets.

Kain's primary weapon is also the [[plasma_sword|Cypher]], though he has also been shown capable of handling a variety of firearms, including a rocket launcher and the hi-tech [i]Shadowtag Bullets[/i] [[machine gun]].

h4. See also

* [[Strider Sheena]]

title: wheeljack
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Wheeljack[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a white Lancia Stratos Turbo 5 race [[car]] sporting Alitalia livery.

He is a mechanical engineer and scientist of the Autobots who constantly invents new weapons and gadgets. 

Motto: [i]"Never do what your enemy expects you to do...".[/i]

title: karnov
body:
An original character that appeared in several [[martial arts]] and action-adventure video games developed by [[Data East]] in the 80s and 90s, becoming the company's mascot during that era.

[b]Jinborov Karnovski[/b] (ジンボロフ・カルノフスキー) also known as  [b]Karnov[/b] (カルノフ [i]Karunofu[/i]) for short, is a strongman popularly illustrated as being from an unspecified part of the [[soviet|Soviet Union]]'s Central Asian Republic. 

He is a big and [[fat]], shirtless, [[bald]] strong warrior with a long [[mustache]] and red [[baggy pants]] who is an expert in hand-to-hand combat and also has several magical powers, as well as the ability to throw fire from his mouth.

Karnov's first appearance was in the 1987 action video game of the same name. He also makes a cameo as the first end of level boss in the [[Dragonninja]] martial arts arcade [[video game]] from 1988.

Karnov also appears as the final boss of the [[Fighter's History]] competitive fighting arcade game from 1993 and as a playable character in its 2 sequels, [i]Fighter's History Dynamite[/i] (known in Europe as [i]Karnov's Revenge[/i]) from 1994 and the final title in the series, [i]Fighter's History: Mizoguchi Kiki Ippatsu!![/i] released in 1995.

title: firefly_(g.i._joe)
body:
A character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toy line, comic books, cartoon and live action film series. 

[b]Firefly[/b] is a mercenary who works for the [[Cobra Command]] [[terrorist]] organization as a relentless saboteur. He is an expert in explosives, sabotage, demolitions and [[terrorism]].

Firefly is portrayed by "Ray Stevenson":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Stevenson_(actor)_ in the 2013 live-action film "G.I. Joe: Retaliation":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Joe:_Retaliation .

title: major_bludd
body:
A character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toyline, comic books and cartoon series by [[Hasbro]] and [[Marvel]] comics. 

[b]Major Sebastian Bludd[/b], usually referred to simply as [b]Major Bludd[/b], is a veteran [[Australia]]n mercenary working for the [[Cobra Command]] [[terrorist]] organization. 

Bludd is easily identified by his eyepatch and Snidely Whiplash-style mustache, as well as an artificial prosthetic right arm.

He first appeared in number 15 of the original G.I. Joe Marvel comics series and his [[action figure]] debuted in 1983. 

Bludd was voiced by "Michael Bell":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Bell_%28actor%29 in the 80s and 90s cartoons.

title: grunt_(g.i._joe)
body:
A character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toyline, comic books and cartoon series by [[Marvel]] comics and [[Hasbro]]. 

[b]Grunt[/b] is a veteran infantryman in the G.I. Joe Team. 

The character debuted as an [[action figure]] in 1982.

title: sci-fi_(g.i._joe)
body:
A character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toyline, comic books and cartoon series by [[Marvel]] comics and [[Hasbro]]. 

[b]Sci-Fi[/b] is a [[laser rifle]] operator trooper in the G.I. Joe Team. 

The character debuted as an [[action figure]] in 1986.

title: marty_tohn
body:
A character from the [[science fiction]] anime movie [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]] from the 80s.

[b]Marty Tohn[/b] is a member of the [i]Royal Space Force[/i]. He is one of [[Shirotsugh Lhadatt]]'s best friends. One of Marty's most cherised possessions is a futuristic looking red [[motorcycle]].

The character is voiced by "Bryan Cranston":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bryan_Cranston ([i]Malcolm in the Middle[/i], [i]Breaking Bad[/i]) in the American dub of the film. Cranston also voiced [[Isamu Dyson]] in the anime [[Macross Plus]].

title: destro
body:
A character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toyline, comic books and cartoon series by [[Hasbro]] and [[Marvel]] comics. 

[b]Laird James McCullen Destro XXIV[/b], usually referred to simply as [b]Destro[/b], is the [[scotland|Scottish]] leader of a weapons manufacturer company and main ordinance supplier for the [[Cobra Command]] [[terrorist]] organization. 

Destro hides his face -which is unknown to many- in a metal [[mask]] forged from beryllium steel and has [[arm guards]] equipped with mini-[[rocket launcher]]s and [[grenade]]s.

He first appeared in number 11 of the original G.I. Joe Marvel comics series and his [[action figure]] debuted in 1983. 

Destro was voiced by "Arthur Burghardt":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Burghardt and "Maurice LaMarche":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_LaMarche in the 80s and 90s cartoons and he is portrayed by English actor "Christopher Eccleston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Eccleston in the 2009 live-action film [i]"G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Joe:_The_Rise_of_Cobra [/i].

title: maria_grace_fleed
body: A character from the [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] [[super robot]] anime series from the 70s.
other_names: グレース・マリア・フリード

title: makiba_hikaru
body: A character from the [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] [[super robot]] anime series from the 70s.

title: henry_dorsett_case
body:
A character from the 80s [[science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]] novel [[Neuromancer]].

[b]Henry Dorsett Case[/b] is a young and skilled hacker who is the protagonist of the story.

title: duke_fleed
body: A character from the [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] [[super robot]] anime series from the 70s.

title: tchallichammi
body:
A character from the [[science fiction]] anime movie [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]] from the 80s.

[b]Tchallichammi[/b] is a member of the [i]Royal Space Force[/i]. He is a very calm, [[long hair]]ed and short young man who is fond of [[cat]]s.

title: saki_vashutal
body:
A character from the [[Area 88]] manga and anime series from the 80s.

[b]Saki Vashutal[/b] is a the commander of the titular "Area 88". 

He is a serious young man that seems to be of middle eastern origin and has long [[black hair]] and a scar in his forehead.

title: telemachus_(ulysses_31)
body:
A character from the 80s [[science fiction]] anime series [[Ulysses 31]].

[b]Telemachus[/b] is the son of [[ulysses_(ulysses_31)|Ulysses]]. He is very intelligent and almost as brave and skilled as his father, but lacking experience.

title: kharock
body:
A character from the [[science fiction]] anime movie [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]] from the 80s.

[b]Kharock[/b] is a member of the [i]Royal Space Force[/i]. He is a tall, serious and intelligent young man with glasses.

title: denta
body:
A character from the [[science fiction]] anime movie [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]] from the 80s.

title: taii
body:
A character from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. 

[b]Taii[/b] is a [[mu_(orguss)|Mu]] human sized sentient [[robot]] that was salvaged and reprogrammed by the crew of the [i]Glomar[/i] [[Emaan]] ship.

Despite his small size he is equipped with concealed [[missile pod]]s in his chest, capable of destroying much bigger enemy mecha. Taii is also armed with a plasma cannon that he uses as cane.

[spoilers]He was apparently destroyed at the end of the original [[Orguss]] series, but is later revealed to have survived and self-repaired himself, ending in another dimension and taking part in the events of [[Orguss 02]] (in modified form) 200 years later. Taii built the advanced [[Orguss 02 (mecha)]] from that series.[/spoilers]

title: terminator:_the_sarah_connor_chronicles
body:
A [[science fiction]] television series spin-off from the [[Terminator (series)|]] series of films. It revolves around the lives of the characters [[Sarah Connor]] and [[John Connor]], following the events of [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]].

The show opened mid-season with a shortened run of nine episodes, January through March 2008. It was the highest-rated new scripted series of the 2007–08 television season and was renewed for a second season, which began on September 8, 2008, and ended April 10, 2009.

Kirin is the only known master of a secret, super-human and high [[energy]] producing combat style that enables him to destroy enemies (and even machines) with his bare hands and feet.

body:
[b]Ashley James "Ash" Williams[/b] is a character and the [[shotgun]] and [[chainsaw]] totting protagonist of [i][b]The [[Evil Dead]][/b][/i] horror and comedy film franchise. 

Created by "Sam Raimi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Raimi , he is portrayed by "Bruce Campbell":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Campbell and is the only character to appear in each entry of the series

In 2008, Ash was selected by Empire magazine as the 24th greatest movie character of all time, and in 2013 was voted by Empire as the greatest horror movie character ever.

title: nekketsu_koukou_dodgeball_bu
body:
[i][b]Nekketsu Kōkō Dodgeball Bu[/b][/i] (熱血高校ドッジボール部 [i]Hot-Blooded High School Dodgeball Club[/i]) is a [[dodgeball]]-based sports and [[martial arts]] [[video game]] produced by "Technos Japan Corp.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Techn%C5%8Ds_Japan originally released as an [[arcade]] game in 1987. It is part of the [[Kunio-kun series]].

The game was released as [i][b]Super Dodge Ball[/b][/i] in western countries.

In Japan, it was the second game starring Technos Japan's video game character [[Kunio-kun]], following [[Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-kun]] (the Japanese version of [i]Renegade[/i]), although the connection between the two games was removed in the western release. 

Various home versions and sequels of the game have been released for various platforms over the years.
other_names: 熱血高校ドッジボール部

title: shaya_thoov
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. 

[b]Shaya Thoov[/b] (シャイア・トーブ [i]Shaia Tōbu[/i]) is the veteran female captain of the [i]Glomar[/i] [[Emaan]] trading ship.

title: sheena_etranzi
body:
[i]LET'S ROCK...!!!!![/i] - Sheena Etranzi, from [i][b]Contra Hard Corps[/b][/i].

Playable fictional female character from the [[Contra]] shooting action [[video game]] series.

[b]Sheena Etranzi[/b] is a futuristic female soldier expert in many types of ballistic and energy long range weapons. 

She first appeared in the [[Contra Hard Corps]] video game released for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[game console]] in 1994. Sheena later appeared in the [[Contra Dual Spirits]] [[Nintendo DS]] portable game from 2008 as a bonus playable character.

title: space_harrier
body:
[i][b]Space Harrier[/b][/i] (スペースハリアー [i]Su-pē-su Ha-riā[/i]) is a third-person [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] rail shooter [[video game]], released by [[SEGA]] in 1985. It was produced by "Suzuki Yu":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu_Suzuki , responsible for many popular and innovative Sega games. 

Space Harrier was ported to various home computer systems and consoles. Among the home versions, the ports for the [[Sega 32X]], the [[Sega Saturn]] and the Sharp [[X68000]] (the latter being a Japan-only release) are considered to be the most faithful to the original arcade version.

The game also spawned several sequels: [i]Space Harrier 3-D[/i] (1988) for the [[Sega Master System]], [i]Space Harrier II[/i] (1988) for the [[Sega Mega Drive]], and the [[arcade]] spin-off [i]Planet Harriers[/i] (2000).

Space Harrier was one of the first arcade games to use 16-bit graphics and Sega's "Super Scaler" technology that allowed pseudo-3D sprite-scaling at high frame rates, with the ability to scale as many as 32,000 sprites and fill a moving landscape with them, along with over 32,000 colours displayed simultaneously on the screen. 

It also introduced a true analog flight stick for movement, with the ability to register movement in any direction as well as measure the degree of push, which could move the player character at different speeds depending on how far the stick is pushed in a certain direction. 

The game was also an early example of a third-person shooter; it was influenced by the earlier 1982 Sega game [i]Buck Rogers: Planet of Zoom[/i], and Space Harrier in turn influenced later 3D shooters such as [[Nintendo]]'s [[Star Fox]] (1993).

h4. See also

* [[Harrier (character)]]

* [[Fantasy Zone]] - Another SEGA game set in the same fictional universe.

title: kuhga_gaiden
body:
[b][i]Skull Fang: Kuhga Gaiden[/i][/b] (スカルファング ～空牙外伝～), known outside of Japan simply as [b][i]Skull Fang[/i][/b], is a 1996 vertical-scrolling shoot 'em up [[science fiction]] arcade [[video game]] developed and published by [[Data East]]. 

Skull Fang is the third and final game in the [[Kuhga]] trilogy and brings back the gameplay of the original [i]Vapor Trail[/i], but substitutes the original 2D graphics with 3D polygonal sprites. Players choose one of four jets set among the "Skull Fang" - a flying aircraft carrier - as well as a roster of 4 different pilots to fly the selected jet and attack enemy terrorist squadrons and battalions world wide. 

The three original experimental jets from Kuhga make a return, and are now complemented with a new powerful plane called the [[BV-04 SIF]], a recently developed [[space]]-[[jet]] with the best handling over the others.

Skull Fang was later ported by both Data East and Aisystem Tokyo to the [[Sega Saturn]] in 1997. This port adds several new features, such as a trial mode, a boss rush mode, a tutorial video and an additional speed mode which has two settings rather than five.

title: strider_hiryuu
body:
[b]Strider Hiryuu[/b] (ストライダー飛竜) is a [[science fiction]] character jointly owned by [[Capcom]] and the [i]Moto Kikaku[/i] [[comic]] studio.

Although primarily known as a [[video game]] character, Hiryuu debuted in 1988 as the protagonist of a manga published exclusively in [[Japan]] by Kadokawa Shoten. 

He made his first video game appearance in the 1989 coin-operated machine [[Strider (video game)|Strider]], which was followed by the release of a [[NES]] game based on the japanese manga released exclusively in North America during the same year. 

Since his debut, Hiryuu (飛竜 "Hiryuu" usually interpreted to mean "Flying Dragon") has appeared in various video games produced by Capcom.

In most versions of the Strider story, Hiryuu is an elite-class member of a group of futuristic, high-tech [[ninja]] known as the "Striders", who specialize in various kinds of wetworks such as espionage, sabotage, and assassinations. Hiryuu is the youngest Strider ever to earn an "A" class rank, what makes him a formidable warrior in any type of battle. His signature weapon is the "Cypher", a [[plasma sword]] with a [[tonfa]]-like handle able to cut through anything.

h4. See also

* [[Strider Kain]]
* [[Strider Sheena]]
* [[Strider Hien]]

title: contra_iii_the_alien_wars
body:
[b][i]Contra III: The Alien Wars[/i][/b], released in Japan as [b][i]Contra Spirits[/i][/b] (魂斗羅スピリッツ) and in the PAL region as [b][i]Super Probotector: Alien Rebels[/i][/b], is a 1992 run and gun game for the [[Super Nintendo]] Entertainment System produced by [[Konami]]. It is the third console iteration of the [[Contra]] series, following the original [i]Contra[/i] and [[Super Contra]] for the NES.

Set in the futuristic year 2636, the [[alien]] invaders that were defeated during the previous installments have decided to launch a full-scale war against mankind on Earth, starting the so called "Alien Wars". 

h4.See also

* [[Bill Rizer]]
* [[Lance Bean]]

title: two_p
body:
An antagonist [[video game]] character from [[Capcom]].

He first appeared in the [[Final Fight]] game from the 80s, and in many other fighting games since then. More recently he appeared in [[Final Fight: Streetwise]], adopting the name Two Ill.

[b]Two P[/b] is part of the original [[Mad Gear]] gang that terrorized the streets of [[Metro City]]. He has an orange [[mohawk]], wears [[sunglasses]], an orange jacket with a dragon symbol on its back and blue baggy jeans. His design is basically a palette swap of [[j_(final_fight)|J]].

These characters are infamously difficult to beat because in the game, they tend to strike when the player has their back turned on one of them, and they appear among crowds of enemies most of the time.

title: slicks
body:
A sentient variable [[robot]] of the [[GoBots]] franchise from the 80s.

[b]Slicks[/b] is an evil member of the GoBot Renegade faction. His alternate mode is a black, orange and grey F-1 racing [[car]].

His original [[Machine Robo]] name was [b]F-1 Robo[/b] and was entirely painted yellow.

title: probotector
body:
[b][i]Probotector[/i][/b] is an alternate title originally given to a number of different [i]Contra[/i] franchise [[video game]]s in the European and PAL regions. 

Their main difference is that the human protagonists of the original games were substituted with generic [[robot]] [[soldier]]s to avoid the exposure of young gamers to depictions of violence between human beings.

By itself, the title was affixed to several different Contra games, and may refer to the European localizations of [[Contra]], [[Super Contra]], [i]Operation C[/i], [[Contra III The Alien Wars]] and [[Contra Hard Corps]].

The original Probotector robot also appeared in the [[Contra Dual Spirits]] [[Nintendo DS]] portable game from 2008 as a bonus playable character.

title: long_john_silver
body: A character from the classic "[[pirate]]s and [[gold]]" adventure novel, [[Treasure Island]].

title: gmp
body:
A military organization from [[choujikuu_kidan_southern_cross|The Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross]] [[mecha]] anime [[Science fiction]] series from the 80s.

The [b]Glorie Military Police[/b], is a colonial [[Military Police]] unit used to keep the other human military units from [[planet Glorie]] in check.

Female officer [[Lana Isavia]] is a notable member of the GMP.

h4.GMP Mecha

* [[GMP Garm]]

title: renegade_battle_suit
body:
An [[alien]] combat mecha from the [[MACROSS]] series. The [b]Renegade Battle Suit[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace [[power armor]].

Its weapons include 2 medium-bore arm cannons (mounted one per arm), 1 triple-barrel gun and 2 small-bore cannons on its torso, 2 large micro-missile launchers in its back and 1 in its front as well as handled weaponry (energy guns and/or rifles).

In [[real life]] this fictional [[mecha]] was originally designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] for the [[Macross Plus]] OVA series from the 90s.

title: tomahawk_(destroid)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV anime series from 1982.

The [b]Viggers/Chrauler MBR-04-Mk VI Tomahawk[/b] [[destroid]] is a main [[battle]] [[robot]] system (mecha) created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight the [[Zentradi]].

Armed with a wide array of weaponry suited to nearly any combat operation, the Tomahawk is a versatile, heavy armed and armored combat mecha that features particle cannons, missiles, machine guns, lasers and flamethrowers to unleash fire in any role from anti-personnel to anti-aircraft. 

One of its most distinct features are its two energy based [[arm cannon]]s. This mecha also features a retractable periscope and includes the option of mounting searchlight/[[missile pod]]s in one or both mounts on either side of its top weapon bays. 

In [[real life]] the Tomahawk was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: macross:_eternal_love_song
body:
[i][b]Choujikuu Yousai Macross: Eien No Love Song[/b][/i] (超時空要塞マクロス―永遠のラヴソング―), also known as [i][b]Macross: Eternal Love Song[/b][/i], is a Japanese console [[video game]] produced by  NCS/Masaya and released for the [[Pc Engine]] Super CD-ROM  in December 4, 1992 only in Japan. 

It is a turn-based, [[mecha]] RPG/strategy simulation and overhead view 2D game set in the [[Macross]] universe.

The plot of the game follows the continuity after the events of [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] and before [[Macross 2]], featuring several original characters. The appeal of the game was largely the anime style cinematics and the [[Macross]] license, since there were no shortage of generic turn based strategy games at the time.   

A companion sci-fi shooter video game called [[Macross 2036]] and related to the plot of [i]Eternal Love Song[/i] was released a few months before this game for the same console.

h4. See also

* [[letlade_elendil|Letlade "Leto" Elendil]]
* [[Misty Klaus]]
* [[Komillia Maria Jenius]]

title: ishikagi_jun'ya
body: Japanese [[mecha]] designer known for his rather unconventional work in later iterations of several classic [[science fiction]] series like [[Gundam]] and [[MACROSS]].

title: athena_henderson
body:
A female character from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. 

[b]Athena Henderson[/b] (アテナ・ヘンダーソン [i]Atena Hendāson[/i]) is a [[Chiram]] soldier and mecha fighter ace [[pilot]].

Her mecha of choice is the Chiram [[Nikick]]. [spoilers]She is actually [[Katsuragi Kei]]'s daughter. Athena grew up during the 20 years it took Kei arrive at the current Earth dimension (where the first series takes place).[/spoilers]

title: doctor_hell
body:

A brillant scientist and a derranged madman bent on conquering the world, Dr. Hell uses both an extensive series of hostile and very powerful [[robot|Mechanical]] [[monster|Beasts]] as well as a small cadre of evil lieutenants and legions of [[cyborg]] soldiers he personally created to achieve this goal.
